Hooks & Filters

Table of contents

  1. TOC {:toc}

Main Usage

You can use the HookInto utility to hook into actions and filters. Genie uses Reflection to work out how many parameters are being use in the closure or function

Basic usage 

use Lnk7\Genie\Utilities\HookInto;
HookInto::action('init')
  ->run(function() {
   // run something here
  });

Setting Priority

The default priority is 10.

use Lnk7\Genie\Utilities\HookInto;
HookInto::action('init', 20)
  ->run(function() {
   // run something here
  });

Using a callback

any callable is accepted by the run() method.

use Lnk7\Genie\Utilities\HookInto;
HookInto::action('init', 20)
  ->run( [\Lnk7\Genie\Debug::class, 'dd']);

Multiple Hooks

You can add multiple hooks or filters at the same time using orAction()
or for filters orFilter()

use Lnk7\Genie\Utilities\HookInto;
HookInto::action('init', 20)
  ->orAction('wp_loaded')
  ->run( function() { 
    // run something
  });

Filters

rather than use action - you can use the filter() method:

use Lnk7\Genie\Utilities\HookInto;
HookInto::filter('the_content')
    ->run( function($content) { 
      // run something
      return $content;
  });
